p: Compound 3 was isolated from the stem bark of Machaerium multiflorum [ 34]. However, no anti-diabetic activity has been reported so far for this compound. Most of the reports indicate its antimicrobial activity against Candida albicans, Cryptococcus neoformans, Mycobacterium intracellularae, Aspergillus fumigatus [ 35], and Staphylococcus aureus [ 34].
